title: Bogus emails showing up in autofill suggestions
content:
I think I got phished.

Mac OS 13.0.1 A couple weeks ago I received an email from Disney+ that contained a verification code to access my account. But I wasn't trying to access my account so I clicked on the link that said 'what to do if you didn't request this.' However that link took me to the Disney+ general help page. I searched their help section but couldn't find anything relevant. So I assumed everything was ok and went back to work.

Later I noticed that all of our Disney+ profiles had been removed and replaced by new ones. I immediately changed the password to my Disney+ account and to my email account. I deleted the profiles created by the hacker and created new ones. I logged out all devices from Disney+. Thought I was good at this point.

Days later I noticed that someone had created another new Disney+ profile which suggests that someone still has access to my account. How could that be? I've tried communicating with Disney+ support staff. This was not helpful. They just say to change the password again. But that didn't solve the problem.

I was about to try contacting Disney+ support again so I went to fill out the information to start the chat session. I noticed 1 bogus email saved in the autofill of the email address field. This would seem to imply that someone has access to my computer and has been chatting directly with Disney+. I downloaded Virus Barrier virus scan but it didn't find anything. Then I went back to the Disney+ chat screen and there were already 2 more bogus emails saved in the autofill. So... is someone using even more email addresses to communicate with Disney+ in the 15 minutes since I detected this?

I went back to the Disney+ email I received and realized that the link I clicked on was suspicious. So I'm suspecting that it did something, then redirected to Disney+ support so I wouldn't suspect anything. Now I'm concerned that someone may have gained access to my computer. But I have no idea how to determine that. I've been on with Apple support for over an hour and they keep insisting that its not possible. And b/c the problem appeared in Firefox that they can't help me.

Any advice would be GREATLY appreciated. Thanks
creator: anthonyvcodispoti

title: Firefox will no longer allow me to access certain sites (that I have been visiting for years)
content:
I was saddened to learn that the Danish help forum (I do not remember its official name) – where two extraordinarily helpful and very capable gentlemen for a total of eighteen times (beginning in 2014) promptly offered solutions to problems (that kept me from working). I sincerely wish to thank them!

But: being unable to find the aforementioned forum anywhere, I guess I will have to try to state my current problem in English instead (even though this involves the added difficulty of my, being an amateur, not knowing the correct translations of the Danish words used in menus &c.

My current problem is this, however: My Firefox Browser (64 bit, version 108.0.1) will no longer allow me to access two (Danish) websites which I have been visiting either daily or several times a week for years (without any difficulty).

One of these sites is the (government-run) official Danish Film Institute at https://www.dfi.dk/.

I have no difficulty getting access to the first (main) page. But when I click on one of the numerous “subordinate” links there (such as: https://www.dfi.dk/cinemateket/biograf), I (frequently, though not every single time) get “error message,” including this “error code”:

SEC_ERROR_REUSED_ISSUER_AND_SERIAL

When I search in Mozilla help forums for advice about what to do about this, I am instructed to get in touch with the owner of the site (i.e., The Danish Film Institute). So I called them, and got in touch with their webmaster (I think it was) who informed that, to his knowledge, there was nothing wrong with their “security protocol” (or whatever he called it) and that he had never had a similar complaint from other users.

Another site, to which I have (since a number of weeks) systematically been denied access (if I use Firefox – but not if I try Microsoft Edge instead) is a small, not-for-profit, amateur-driven, web-based Danish radio-station (to which I have been listening (and paying my dues) for decades): https://www.radiojazz.dk/.

When I try, I get the same error-code:

SEC_ERROR_REUSED_ISSUER_AND_SERIAL

I did sent an e-mail to the station, but they haven’t answered. (I cannot blame them, they are only a small handful of volunteers.)

My operating system is Windows 10 (yes, I know there is a new edition, but at least the one I have is fully updated).

Can anyone tell me how to get Firefox to re-install the certificates the browser thinks it is missing?

Kind regards, and season’s greetings from Nikolaj Lunoe Copenhagen, Denmark
creator: nikolaj2

title: Custom icons on a page/domain do not work, or only work temporarily.
content:
Hello !

I just started using the Lnk.Bio service for my personal social media links etc.

Everything is fine on my Android Phone but the browser version of the page seems to have trouble loading the icons, which are replaces by rectangles with two rows of numbers/letters only.

This only seems to happen on the Firefox Browser and I obviously tried switching all add-ons and plug-ins to see any difference but it didn't, and the strange part is that it works fine in Incognito Mode, but is still not displaying right in Safe Mode/Troubleshooting Mode.

I contacted admins of Lnk.Bio and we tried a few solutions, but none worked except when we cleared cache on the Web Developer Tools (Ctrl + SHift + i > 'Cache Storage' > Delete 'V68') but it only worked for one page (not the whole domain) and the single page returned back to the same state (icons not loading).

Is it possible that there is some sort of bug with the Firefox Browser ?

Thanks in advance !
creator: adarsh0765

title: Chybová hlášení a nefunkčnost FB
content:
Dobrý den. Podruhé během jednoho týdne se mi stalo, že mi na PC přestal jít FB - objevuje se toto hlášení: Sorry, something went wrong. We're working on getting this fixed as soon as we can. Momentálně situace trvá cca 14 hod, minule trvala také tak. PC jsem restartovala, na Google chrome na PC i v telefonu FB bez problémů funguje.

Nedávno se mi také začalo objevovat chybové hlášení "máme problém s obnovením vašich panelů" i při novém zapnutí PC, po restartu apod.

Aktualizace firefoxu mám automaticky, aktualizace Windows 10 také, antivirák AVG aktuální, AVG využívám i k optimalizace systému PC.

Děkuji za info, jak problémy odstranit.

title: Firefox crashing only during video playback
content:
I'm using the latest version of Firefox on an updated Fedora Linux installation. I am experiencing for a while now random crashing while watching videos. The playback crashing is random, so I could be watching 5 videos one after another with no crashing and then one video will cause it to crash. The video causing is site agnostic, so it could crash from any site, not just YouTube. I saw in bugzilla something that I thought was related to the crashing (https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1779558) but it got resolved and it still keeps happening to me.

It's getting tiresome, please. What do I need to send you to help me fix this problem?
